Page.Content:
HydrogenCMS is a simple page management application build using asp.net mvc, and references from awesome web apps like BlogEngine and Kigg, to name a few.  (If you haven't checked these open source applications out, you are missing out.)  And, in all actuality, BlogEngine could do everything this system can do, and, in most cases, better.  And, with the planned enhancements to the page model in BlogEngine, it should cover everything.  But, they are using different technologies (linq, mvc), so even if you don't use Hydrogen as your web site, it still has some value as a reference application.

HydrogenCMS started out, and to some extent, is still an experiment using some new techniques and the asp.net mvc framework.  It still has a way to go, but it is usable in its current form.  You may need to do some enhancements on the the navigation and what not until those things get ironed out, but overall, it is a decent reference.  And, as time goes on, it will only get better.

This application was written by Jesse Foster | jf26028 from GravityCube with inspiration from Adam Zastawski and Jason Lay.  If you have any enhancements or suggestions, I'll put your name here, too.

This site serves as a demo of the application, and the source can be downloaded from the Codeplex site.
Page.Title: About

Page.Content:
Welcome to the HydrogenCMS.

HydrogenCMS is a light, extendable cms designed for simplicity and ease of use.  It enables anyone to manage their content own content with as simple a tool as Windows Live Writer.

The application is not finished, but it is functional, and this site is running the latest version.  The source will be available on the CodePlex site as soon as I get it all checked in.
Page.Title: Home

Page.Content:
So, what, exactly, can HydrogenCMS do?   Both, the wonderful, and not so great, answer is, "Just enough".

HydrogenCMS was designed to be as light and simple as possible.  Right now, all it does is serve dynamic pages that you enter via a blogging tool like Live Writer.  There are plans for plug-ins and extensions in the near future, but as of right now, it just serves pages.

Under the covers, there are quite a few features that developers will find useful.

  • Configurable data storage.  SqlServer via Linq2Sql and xml via Linq2Xml
  • Easily skinned with the skin configured in the admin panel.
  • Cached data for lightning fast pages.
  • Google Sitemap.
  • Simple page management (Managed from LiveWriter)

If all this sounds too simple, that's because it is.  There are some things that still need to be done/bugs.

  • More skins
  • Compression
  • Cleanup
  • Unit Tests
  • Search
  • Contact Page
  • Finish plug-in/extension architecture
  • More options/page configuration (right now, there is none!)
  • When working in LiveWriter, it does not pull back the Keywords or Slug.
  • More to come...
